CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, page A13, reads: "A 'Queen' is Crowned - Mrs. Elaine Mitchell (seated) is being crowned by Mrs. Beatrice Stewart (second from left) as the inner in the 'King or Queen for a Day' program sponsored by the 20th District, Fifth Ward, Community Club. The contest was staged at Addison Hall on July 25. Others in the picture are, left to right: Mrs. Ollie Brown, Mrs. Stewart, Addison Dukes, president, and Mary Howard, chairman. Walter Wilson, not shown, is a member of the club, also. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Four women and a man, left to right: Mrs. Ollie Brown, Elaine Mitchell crowning Beatrice Stewart, holding large bouquet of gladiolus, Addison Dukes, and Mary Howard, gathered in gymnasium at Addison Hall, Terrace Village, for the 'King or Queen for a Day' program sponsored by the 20th District, Fifth Ward, Community Club
